values.description:
Welcome to Brightonism! A site for watching Brighton's creative talent. Launching May 2011 - We're not open just yet but thanks for having a peek :) You can keep track of our pre-launch progress on Twitter.

Please use #brightonism and @brightonism to support us!
values.name: Brightonism

values.description:
You need corporate entertainment that is so memorable that your delegates will still be talking about it at next years event. 
 
If you need conference entertainment that is totally engaging and is about your company, then look no further!
 
We will turn your after dinner show or award ceremony into an occasion that will be talked about for years to come.
 
Sit back and enjoy the magic on stage as names, characters and episodes from your workplace are woven into scenes or your last meeting becomes the subject of a song. 

The Maydays was founded by John Cremer in Brighton in 2001. There are currently 10 company members including our MD, Joe Samuel.

As well as a residency at Brighton Komedia, the company has performed to an enormously diverse range of clients, including:
Investec
British Council - International Climate Champions Conference
Norfolk Diocese - Clergy Conference
Weald Horticultural Society - Centenary Show
Professional Speakers Association
Various Weddings & Birthdays
Character role play at Record Launches, Secret Cinema and club nights

Its a great experience, an excellent way to spend a couple of hours each week with other people. Great to just laugh and have tears in your eyes watching your course mates. A interesting path of self discovery and of course wonderful tutors! Do it, I think every one should at least have a go at improv.
Stephen D, Beginners Course Spring 2010
values.name: The Maydays
Rocket Science (Brighton)
values.description:
Rocket Science is a toy store for the whole family. We have got things for customers from 1 to 99 years old.  

We are very proud of our toys selection. They come from all over the world: France, Denmark, Spain, Australia, Russia, Japan (some come from China, of course). We work with local artists and artisans and stock beautiful postcards, prints, t-shirts, games, sweets and jewellery created by them.

We are very DIY oriented that’s why we stock and use art supplies and art sets from DJECO, KIDSONROOF, Japanese washi tapes and activity books from ANORAK. We’ve got lots of clay, coloured sands, paint, origami/kirigami sets, beads, stamps and everything one needs to make their own kite.

Did we say we love science? Yes, we do. At rocket science you’ll find books filled with experiments, giant microbes, encyclopaedias, microscopes and telescopes, horrible science kits, space shuttles and even astronaut ice-cream (from NASA headquarters).

We’ve got a nice selection of beautifully designed board games.

Our games are for ages 2 to 99, and 2 of them are created by local artists and thinkers.

We love to read (and talk in different languages), that’s why we stock books and children’s magazines (ANORAK and OKIDO) in different languages.

values.name: Silent Disco Brighton
values.description:
The South’s answer for all your silent disco needs. But what exactly is a silent disco….?

A silent disco is unlike any other experience for one simple, but very important reason: absolutely no music is played aloud. Sometimes referred to as a “headphone party” or a “headphone disco”, all the party-goers slip-on a pair of the wireless headphones, which we provide. They then listen to music transmitted to the headphones from your chosen source – whether that is a live DJ or an alternative source, such as an IPod, MP3 Player or Laptop. Another advantage is that these headphones can be switched between two separate channels, providing your guests the opportunity to decide what they would rather listen to – an option not available at your average party! So, while half your guests are enjoying 80s cheese that is playing on channel “A” and dancing to the Y-M-C-A, the other half can be rocking out to Nirvana on channel “B” – the choice is theirs!

Lola Lo Tiki Bar & Nightclub, Brighton
values.description:
Fly free into a bounty paradise at Lola Lo, an intimate Tiki bar and club which will transport you to a tropical oasis where the party goes on and on. At Lola Lo, we've taken a dazzling array of showstopping cocktails, champagnes and rums and mixed it with an intoxicating blend of credible club classics and contemporary beats and are serving it all in a setting that captures the pure essence of care-free South Pacific joie de vivre. From a stunning interior featuring bamboo, hand-carved woods, evocative lighting, unique dancefloor and rustic decor to private booths and effervescent bar tenders.

The perfect venue for corporate events and parties, Lola Lo is available for Private Hire and VIP table or booth bookings. Get in touch or visit our website http://www.lolalobrighton.com for more information.

values.name: Brighton Tools and Fixings Ltd

values.description:
If you think Age Concern is only for the very elderly, think again - we are for everyone over the age of 50 and also for these who support or care for those over this age.

   As our local City Council faces reductions of at least 28% over the next 4 years it is inevitable that those who are struggling to stay independent in their own homes will get less support from the Council, and Health, and they will turn to us even more. Our values mean that this organisation will not simply cut and reduce services, in fact the Board of Trustees have been clear that we must prioritise any savings so that protect our direct delivery to the client group.

   What we know for sure is that whatever the Big Society is, a concept that is such an important part of the Prime Ministers' thinking; it cannot be achieved without organisations like ours. Otherwise, yet again, older people and their local groups will be left behind because older people do not shout or work in `sound bites'.



   The people we work with are not lonely victims they are funny, rude, outrageous and only limited by the society in which they live. If we all want them to enjoy their lives we can choose for that to happen.
values.name: Age Concern Brighton Hove & Portslade
